review.title: Hybrid data clustering approach using K-Means and Flower Pollination Algorithm
review.abstract: Data clustering is a technique for clustering set of objects into known number of groups. Several approaches are widely applied to data clustering so that objects within the clusters are similar and objects in different clusters are far away from each other. K-Means, is one of the familiar center based clustering algorithms since implementation is very easy and fast convergence. However, K-Means algorithm suffers from initialization, hence trapped in local optima. Flower Pollination Algorithm (FPA) is the global optimization technique, which avoids trapping in local optimum solution. In this paper, a novel hybrid data clustering approach using Flower Pollination Algorithm and K-Means (FPAKM) is proposed. The proposed algorithm results are compared with K-Means and FPA on eight datasets. From the experimental results, FPAKM is better than FPA and K-Means.
histories: 11 pages, Journal. Advanced Computational Intelligence: An International Journal (ACII), Vol.2, No.2, April 2015
review.COMMENTS: 11 pages, Journal. Advanced Computational Intelligence: An International Journal (ACII), Vol.2, No.2, April 2015

sections.text: The K-Means algorithm (Flower Pollination Algorithm, FPA) is the global optimization technology that avoids a trap in the local optimal solution. In this paper, a novel hybrid data cluster approach using the Flower Pollination Algorithm and K-Means (FPAKM) is proposed, and the proposed algorithm results are compared with K-Means and FPA on eight datasets. Experimental results show that FPAKM is better than FPA and K-Means. KEYWORDS cluster analysis, K-Means, Flower Pollination algorithm, global optimum, swarm intelligence, nature-inspired methods.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: In fact, people are able to decide for themselves what they want and what they want.

sections.heading: 2. RELATED WORK
sections.text: The author proposed two approaches to clustering: the first is PSO, in which the optimal centroids are found and then these optimal centroids are used as seeds in an artificial K-mean algorithm, and the second is that the PSO method for clustering is used by Shelokar et al. (2004). Both approaches have been tested and the results show that both PSO clustering techniques have great potential. Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) method for clustering is used by Shelokar et al. (2004) [14], the authors used distributed agents that mimic the way real ants find the shortest route from their nest to a food source and back. Results obtained by ACO can be considered viable and is an efficient heuristic to find near optimal cluster representation for clustering.

sections.heading: 3. K-MEANS ALGORITHM
sections.text: K-Means clustering algorithm is fast and easy to implement. Due to its simplicity, K-Means clustering is widely used. The process of clustering by K-Means is as follows: O = {o1, o2,..., on} be a set of n data objects to be partitioning and each data object oi, i = 1,2,... n is represented as oi = {oi1, oi2,...., oim} where ois mth dimension value of data object i.The output clustering algorithm is a set of K partitions P = Pk: Pk воii1, P2, Pk-k: Pk воссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссссснннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннннн

sections.heading: 4. FLOWER POLLINATION ALGORITHM (FPA)
sections.text: The Flower Pollination Algorithm (FPA) is a global optimisation algorithm introduced in 2012 by Xin-She Yang [19], inspired by the pollination process of flowers. There are two key steps in the FPA: one is global pollination and the other is local pollination. In the global pollination step, insects fly and move at greater distances and the fittest is represented by g *. The flowering process at greater distances is carried out with delivery flights. Mathematically, the global pollination process is described as

sections.heading: 5. FLOWER POLLINATION ALGORITHM WITH K-MEANS (FPAKM)
sections.text: In this paper, the flower pollination algorithm is integrated with K-Means (FPAKM) to form a hybrid cluster algorithm that provides all the functionality of FPA and K-Means. If the currently best solution does not improve in a given number of trials, a local search for the current best solution is performed. The maximum of trials is the limit value. The objective function used is the Total Mean Square Quantization Error (MSE). The proposed algorithm is given in Fig. (3).

sections.heading: 6. EXPERIMENTAL RESULTS AND DISCUSSION
sections.text: The K-Means, Flower Pollination Algorithm (FPA) and the proposed algorithm (FPAKM) were written in Matlab 8.3 and executed in a Windows 7 Professional OS environment with Intel i3, 2.30 GHz, 2 GB RAM. Flower Pollination Algorithm (FPA) Matlab code is available in [34]. For comparison, FPA, FPAKM are executed with parameters other than the limit as shown in Table 1.

sections.heading: 6.1 Dataset Description
sections.text: To evaluate the performance of the proposed algorithm, eight datasets were used, one of which is an artificial dataset from Kao et al. (2008), and the remaining seven datasets, iris, thyroid, wine, contraceptive method choice (CMC), crude oil, and glass, are from [36]. The artificial dataset contains samples from five independent, uniform distributions with ranges of (85,100), (70, 85), (55, 70), (40, 55), and (25, 40). The eight datasets used in this paper are described in Table 2.

sections.heading: 6.2 Performance Evaluation
sections.text: The quality of the cluster algorithms is measured on the basis of the objective function value and the F-measure. The smaller the objective function value is, the higher the quality of clustering. The F-measurement uses the precision and retrieval values used in obtaining information. Accuracy P (i, j) and retrieval R (i, j) of each cluster j for each class i are calculated as (,) = (8), where βi: the number of members of class i βj: is the number of members of cluster j βij: is the number of members of class i in cluster j. The corresponding F-measurement F (i,) is given in the equation. (9): (,) = 2 (,) (,) () + (,) (9) Then the F-measure of a class i can be defined.

sections.heading: 6.3 Results Discussion
sections.text: To compare the performance of the proposed algorithm, each algorithm was executed ten times and the best, worst, average and standard deviations of the objective functional values of each algorithm and F measurements are presented in Table 3. The best values are presented in bold. For the Art1 artificial dataset, the FPAKM algorithm receives the best objective functional value and the Fmeasurement value is 1 for the FPA and FPAKM algorithms, while the K-Means algorithm also provides the maximum F measurement. For all datasets except cmc data, the FPAKM performs better than the other two algorithms and achieves the best value in terms of objective functional values and F measurements. For datasets Art1, Iris, Wine, Cancer, Thyroid, Crude Oil, the FPA receives the maximum F measurement over 10 passes. But FPAKM always achieves the best results compared to FPA and K readings.

sections.heading: 7. CONCLUSION
sections.text: This paper introduces a hybrid cluster algorithm (FPAKM) based on the K-Means and the Flower Pollination algorithms. Results of the proposed algorithm are compared with K-Means and the flower pollination algorithm. It turns out that the proposed algorithm finds optimal cluster centers, which increases the F-reading. In the near future, this algorithm can be used to solve other optimization problems.

referenceMentions.context: Data clustering [4] [6] is an unsupervised learning technique in which class labels are not known in advance.
Nature-inspired algorithms [2] [3] imitate the behaviours of the living things in the nature, so they are also called as Swarm Intelligence (SI) algorithms.
Genetic Algorithm (GA) [6] and Simulated Annealing (SA) [7] are popular examples for EAs.

The rising body of Swarm Intelligence(SI) [2] [3] metaheuristic algorithms include Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) [1] [5], Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) [14], Glowworm Swarm Optimization (GSO) [8], Bacterial Foraging Optimization (BFO) [9-10], the Bees Algorithm [31], Artificial Bee Colony algorithm (ABC) [25][28-29], Biogeography-based optimization (BBO) [30] , Cuckoo Search (CS) [26-27], Firefly Algorithm (FA) [32-33] , Bat Algorithm (BA) [20] and flower pollination algorithm[19] .

The rising body of Swarm Intelligence(SI) [2] [3] metaheuristic algorithms include Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) [1] [5], Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) [14], Glowworm Swarm Optimization (GSO) [8], Bacterial Foraging Optimization (BFO) [9-10], the Bees Algorithm [31], Artificial Bee Colony algorithm (ABC) [25][28-29], Biogeography-based optimization (BBO) [30] , Cuckoo Search (CS) [26-27], Firefly Algorithm (FA) [32-33] , Bat Algorithm (BA) [20] and flower pollination algorithm[19] .

(2003) [5] proposed data clustering approach using particle swarm optimization.
(2008) [22] proposed a hybridized approach that combines PSO technique, Nelder– Mead simplex search and the K-means algorithm.
Karaboga and Ozturk (2011) [15] presented a new clustering approach using Artificial Bee Colony (ABC) algorithm
(2010) [23] presented the artificial bee colony (ABC) as a state-of-the-art approach to clustering.
(2012) [19] presented a new PSO approach to the data clustering and the algorithm was tested using two synthetic datasets and five real datasets.
Wan and his co-authors (2012) [17] presented data clustering using Bacterial Foraging Optimization (BFO).
Flower Pollination Algorithm (FPA) is a global optimization algorithm, which was introduced by Xin-She Yang in 2012 [19], inspired by the pollination process of flowers.

metadata.abstractText: Data clustering is a technique for clustering set of objects into known number of groups. Several approaches are widely applied to data clustering so that objects within the clusters are similar and objects in different clusters are far away from each other. K-Means, is one of the familiar center based clustering algorithms since implementation is very easy and fast convergence. However, K-Means algorithm suffers from initialization, hence trapped in local optima. Flower Pollination Algorithm (FPA) is the global optimization technique, which avoids trapping in local optimum solution. In this paper, a novel hybrid data clustering approach using Flower Pollination Algorithm and K-Means (FPAKM) is proposed. The proposed algorithm results are compared with K-Means and FPA on eight datasets. From the experimental results, FPAKM is better than FPA and K-Means.
